whyCrux.title: Why Crux Consulting?
whyCrux.subtitle: Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) are the backbone of the economy in the European Union and play a central role in employment, revenue generation, and overall economic health. At the same time, they often lack the capacity to invest in AI on a large scale. This is where we come in to support you quickly and efficiently, unlocking the full potential of AI and automation available to us today.

aiCompliance.title: AI Compliance Consulting
aiCompliance.description: Navigate EU AI Act requirements with confidence through our comprehensive compliance consulting services.

hero.title: Always be on the <compliant>compliant</compliant> side
hero.subtitle: The EU AI Act adds to the bureaucratic burden for SMEs, and our mission is to tackle exactly that. With us you are guaranteed to be modern, fast, efficient and compliant.

services: Deliver project documentation with AI systems we deliver
Create project documentation for already in place systems
Audit of AI systems in place against compliance requirements
General consulting services around AI systems and their implementation
We consult act as the mediator between legal and IT team, developing the ideal solutions together

riskLevels.title: AI Act Risk-Based Approach for AI Systems

prohibited.title: Prohibited
prohibited.description: AI systems that pose unacceptable risks are banned
prohibited.details: Social scoring, facial recognition, dark pattern AI, manipulation

highRisk.title: High-risk
highRisk.description: Strict requirements for conformity assessments and documentation
highRisk.details: Safety components in critical infrastructure, employment & performance in work, access to education, access to public services, use in insurance, credit scoring, border control, justice systems

limited.title: Limited risk
limited.description: Limited obligations for transparency and information to users
limited.details: General purpose AI and AI systems with specific transparency requirements such as chatbots, emotion recognition systems

minimal.title: Minimal to no risk
minimal.description: No specific obligations under the AI Act

items.title: AI Act Approved by European Parliament
items.body: The European Parliament officially approved the AI Act, marking a historic milestone in AI regulation worldwide.

items.title: AI Act Enters into Force
items.body: The AI Act officially entered into force, beginning the regulatory framework implementation across the EU.

items.title: Prohibition Rules Apply
items.body: Prohibited AI practices become illegal, including social scoring systems and manipulation techniques.

items.title: General-Purpose AI Model Rules Apply
items.body: Obligations for general-purpose AI models and foundation models come into effect.

items.title: High-Risk AI System Rules Apply
items.body: Full compliance requirements for high-risk AI systems must be implemented.

items.title: AI Act Fully Applicable
items.body: All provisions of the AI Act are fully applicable across all member states.

cta.title: Ensure Your AI Systems are Compliant
cta.description: Don't let compliance requirements slow down your AI innovation. Our experts will guide you through the EU AI Act requirements.

companyStatus.title: Company Status
companyStatus.description: This company is registered in Germany and operates under German law.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.description: The contents of our pages have been created with the utmost care. However, we cannot guarantee the contents' accuracy, completeness or topicality. According to statutory provisions, we are furthermore responsible for our own content on these web pages.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.paragraph1: We take the protection of your personal data very seriously and handle your personal data confidentially and in accordance with the statutory data protection regulations and this privacy policy.
introduction.paragraph2: This privacy policy informs you about the type, scope and purpose of the processing of personal data within our online offering and the associated websites, functions and content.

responsible.title: Responsible Party
responsible.paragraph1: The responsible party for data processing on this website is:

accessData.title: Access Data and Server Log Files
accessData.paragraph1: We collect information about every access to the server on which this service is located (so-called server log files). The access data includes:

items.browserType: Name of the retrieved web page
items.referrerUrl: Operating system used by the accessing computer
items.requestTime: Date and time of the server request

accessData.paragraph2: This data is used for the purpose of ensuring a smooth connection establishment of the website, ensuring comfortable use of our website, evaluating system security and stability as well as for other administrative purposes.

contact.title: Contact
contact.paragraph1: When you contact us via the contact form or email, the data you provide will be stored by us for the purpose of processing your inquiry and in case of follow-up questions.
contact.paragraph2: We do not pass on this data without your consent.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.paragraph1: You have the following rights regarding your personal data:

items.dataAccess: Right to information about your stored personal data
items.dataCorrection: Right to correction of incorrect personal data
items.dataDeletion: Right to deletion of your stored personal data
items.processingRestriction: Right to restriction of data processing
items.processingObjection: Right to object to data processing

rights.paragraph2: If you have given your consent to data processing, you can revoke this at any time. Such revocation affects the permissibility of personal data processing after you have given it to us.
rights.paragraph3: If you believe that the processing of your personal data violates data protection law or your data protection rights have been violated in any other way, you can file a complaint with the supervisory authority.

changes.title: Changes to this Privacy Policy
changes.paragraph1: We reserve the right to change this privacy policy to always comply with current legal requirements or to implement changes to our services in the privacy policy, e.g., when introducing new services.

cookies.title: Cookies and Similar Technologies
cookies.paragraph1: Our website uses only strictly necessary cookies that are essential for the technical operation of the website. These cookies are required for basic website functionality and do not require your consent.
cookies.paragraph2: We use one functional cookie for storing sidebar preferences, which expires after 7 days. This cookie is considered strictly necessary for providing the service you requested.
cookies.paragraph3: We do not use cookies for marketing, analytics, or tracking purposes that would require your consent under GDPR regulations.
